author: zepereshk
body: I was there man, I went from $20k to $83k then in 3 weeks to $1,800. It's frustrating and soul-crushing at first, but liberating in a weird way, like you've hit rock bottom. You'll have to really try to control your impulses, stay away from super short-term plays, take profit very frequently, and don't overreact when things are not going your way. This game man is always you against you. Since I went down to $1,800, I was able to build my account back to $52k, and now I try as hard as I can to just be cerebral, and control my fucking impulse. It's hard but doable. Don't think about going back to $55k now, just think about making like $1k at a time and take profit as much as possible. Godbless!

author: Brawmethius
body:
That is when factors that Nikola can't control come into effect. Their positioning on everything I think is to prop stock price until then, which used to include the now canceled Nikola World. 

Things that happen in Dec.

1. The GM contract has to be finalized by Dec 3. 
2. Lots of share lockups end in December as well.

Quarterly reports don't mean shit for them. Everyone already knows they don't make money and don't expect to make money anytime soon. 

Rest is storytime:

If this company is a fraud here is what the insiders want to do.
Sell their investment with out losing money or getting caught up in legal battles for fraud. 

So how do you do this? Your shares are locked up until December. Therefore you want stock price to stay as high as possible until you can. But you can't come out and double down on fraud; currently Trevor Milton is the fraudster at the center of the story and you are an unlucky defrauded investor. Definitely don't want the "new management" to also get caught up in the narrative that they are lying about capabilities which is what got you into this mess in the first place. When you sell out you also don't want to be in the cross hairs for legal repercussions. You just need out and your bare minimum goal is not at a loss. 

So the first thing you do is change the narrative, maybe release some kind of new management plan. Scrub everything related to the impossible promises from trevor milton. Maybe something like:

https://nikolamotor.com/press_releases/nikola-executing-strategy-and-vision-to-deliver-innovative-technology-energy-and-transportation-solutions-98

Okay. Interesting, look at that. Nikola One and Two are completely gone, badger isn't mentioned. Completely focus on the only thing that might actually exist, the 'Tre' (which was built and designed by another company). Make a timeline 2+ years out where everything important to the core value of the company starts to happen. So far out no more questions on that. Great now you don't have to showcase anything in the near future. No fuel cells, no nothing other than a battery truck with the 'Tre'; also primarily in Germany/Europe. Also decouple yourself with GM expectations.

Fantastic, you have now set yourself up to deliver nothing from now until when you can sell your shares other than show a working 'Tre' which was already built by someone else. And announce a hydrogen partnership (keyword announce a possible partnership, not do anything). Throw in a little disclaimer at the bottom that all of these deliverables depend on market conditions. Awesome. You just stabilized the discussion around what your company does into speculation, away from fraud and you don't have to prove anything that has been contested before you can sell your shares. Also you have removed the wild claims and have a luke warm timeline focused around the 'Tre'. SO when you walk away, you haven't defrauded anyone. When nikola becomes a shitty company with their single crappy BeV truck the 'Tre' that is exactly what you just timelined out for people.

But there is still one more thorn in your side. Nikola world. Promised in december to hype up prices, but needs to have deliverables. They promised to show off al this awesome shit like the One the Two the Tre and the Badger. Plus some other hydrogen shit and software. Fucking problem we have here mate, we just excluded all of that shit from our new management plan and we clearly don't have any of it. What do? Cancel Nikola world. Perfect.

Now we have sell in December, there is no narrative or defending tervors fraud. And when this company becomes a one trick pony with just the 'Tre' or they try to pivot to a commercial hydrogen provider, we haven't defrauded anyone. 

I know that was long story time. But if you believe they are fraud, then think about what you would need to do if you knew it was a fraud and had millions locked up and you wanted out with out seeing the inside of a jail cell.

author: Used_Principle_941
body:
This is a classic con job. Raise money for initialize investors, do some razzle dazzle to gain more cash. Once your cash heavy and people start to question you, take that cash and “partner” with reputable names. GM and CNH Industrials are, to my understanding, just providing services. Now if nikola admitted that they don’t have the expertise to build what they promised, they would be done with. 

The trick is to call these contracted companies “partners”.  Partner suggests a joint venture where both parties are contributing to a mutually beneficial goal. In the case of Nikola, the “partners” have no skin in the game, if Nikola folded tomorrow, all they would lose is a paycheck for services. Now if your a contractor working for another company, you’d be stupid to admit there is a problem publicly, so these companies express optimism knowing they have nothing to lose. All this builds investors confidence as the house of cards keeps being built.

I could be wrong, but I’m pretty sure that’s what this is. I am short Nikola.

author: BobbyPhistHer
body:
I want to insult you so bad, but I’ll try to help instead. The federal reserve did not design the stimulus to inflate the stock market. Big money is putting the funds into the market, because it’s one of the only way to make returns right now. Savings accounts are shit because of the lowered interest rates. It’s easier to borrow money, so the banks are lending and people are putting the money into real estate (inflated asset prices)...same with gold, silver, etc.

The majority of the population don’t understand economics, so they don’t realize how fucked everything is right now. I assume the fed dishes the money out with good intentions, but smart money understands how fucked the economy is and will be in the future. They’re just trying to make as much as they can before the real crash, and the wealth gap will be tremendous.

author: gaybearishair
body:
amd is my favorite stock and i’ve been bullish on it for a while


i said to buy a 75c expiring in october 


if u did that, congrats. shit printed.



i’m no longer super bullish on them. 



here’s why:


1. if you look at amd’s chart all-time you will see just how cyclical semiconductors really are.


2. yes, the future looks bright for amd. i thought this when the price was 50 dollars. when it hit 60 i was amazed. when it hit 70 i was ecstatic. when this shit hit 90 i was on a plane of euphoria.


the problem is that the stock basically HAS to outperform for YEARS to live up to its valuation now. 


i wouldn’t be surprised if amd went up another 3% tomorrow. i’m not shorting it. but the valuations are insane. 


need i remind you amd was a penny stock just 5 years ago.

author: haasvacado
body:
So what the fuck was that all about today?  

Are we just chalking it up to very high volume holding pattern over st.im.my talks that everyone knows are going to fail? 

Is this retail showing a pavlovian response to buying every.fucking.dip? Because that price action certainly did not look like retail. 

And what were those huge orders about? Is SoftBank trying to pull that same shit now in October? Is that someone with balls of steel trying to trick retail into thinking so?

My least favorite thing about the market is how we never get definitive answers to these why questions; just hypotheses of varying completeness.

author: htdwps
body:
I'll just sleep and wake up Monday.

I feel the company is legit and they have ample amounts of news they can release, but they're not going to drop 10 press releases tomorrow just to prop up their share price, that's unrealistic. 

Anyone who came in with the DEAC and VTIQ expectations may be disappointed. At the time nkla ran, TSLA had a killer week, the same parameters no longer hold true now. The big boys control the money and they don't let that slip on them twice. Similar to how ZM 🚀 after their ER only to have docu take a 💩.

Your cost average seems high, but in the long run it's probably going to be a floor of support. Just keep in mind lots of people who bought this recently came in because of NKLA and all the ev stocks, it will be on to the next one for them.

author: a2options
body:
As a new investor since Jan 1 2020. I would have days where I would have mental breakdowns if it was a red day. NOW?   shiiii....i don't even blink an eye. I dont panic sell, I've learned a ton these past 9 months, and have limited my mistakes.

I think one key factor thats missing from this Saul is that when there is money in the bank, those worries don't compound. I have a successful business along with other income from rental properties.

I'm not worried because I know I have steady money coming in. For these younger folks yoloing to get rich, and emptying their accounts its very emotional for them i would imagine.

Congratulations on your wealth, im sure you put in hard hours and sacrificed alot, because that's how you build wealth, at least it was for me!

Godspeed Saul!

And far more during the colder months. While many restaurants died because they couldn't weather the initial shutdown attempts against covid, there are many which are barely surviving because they get to have out door dining.

As the weather cools, out door dining will be far less feasible, causing even more to die at this point.

It's such a shame, if everyone wore masks and socially distanced from the beginning, and stayed home if they had covid, then this wouldn't have happened. We would have been in a much better position now.

author: drnick5
body:
The problem is, how long does this "Strategic funk" last?     

Intel has been stagnant for YEARS now, being stuck on 14nm, while AMD has closed the performance gap. That doesn't seem to be coming to an end anytime soon either given all the delays they've had. Last they said, they won't have 7nm chips out until 2022! At that point, AMD will be rolling out 5nm chips.      
   
Then you can talk about the multiple security vulnerabilities they've had with in their chips, with their only solution being "Turn off hyper treading, that will fix it". Eventually they released some fixes, but this also hurt CPU performance. 

I'm not going to say INTC is a sinking ship or anything, I just don't really see them as being that undervalued.

author: hak8or
body:
And far more during the colder months. While many restaurants died because they couldn't weather the initial shutdown attempts against covid, there are many which are barely surviving because they get to have out door dining.

As the weather cools, out door dining will be far less feasible, causing even more to die at this point.

It's such a shame, if everyone wore masks and socially distanced from the beginning, and stayed home if they had covid, then this wouldn't have happened. We would have been in a much better position now.

Usually leading up to a big event, IV is usually >100. Depending on the company and what is going on it can easily be 150-200+.

Edit: for example, TSLA, with not a lot going on right now is still >70. NKLA is >200 with everything going on right now. Some of the bigger ERs last quarter had IV jumping up in that 150+ range easy.

author: scopolamine
body:
Gary Kaltbaum is on fire:

>Look, my biggest worry with JPow is that he thinks that he is a God. The thing is that somebody tickle with what inflation or deflation is gonna do down the road or keep rates 0% for the next 3 years, you gotta give me a break with that. And I gotta tell you, nobody is asking JPow one question that I would be asking if I was in FOMC press conference. So Mr. Powell, if the markets drop 10%, would you just print another $10TN, what number would you go to, what number is high enough for you? And nobody is asking that question. And that is the big worry. He can never ever rollback what he is doing now. If he today just said I am gonna stop printing money, Dow would be down a thousand points and that is what I mean by markets being addicted. I just wish he would back away from financial markets, because that is not going to be about real economy and employers and employee. Not him tinkering with printing money and buying APPL bonds.

He is not wrong though.

author: bonghits96
body:
> Even if TD leaves me holding bags after ticker switch, the SP would have to drop an additional 30% for selling the warrants to make sense. Am I wrong?

You're not wrong. With the warrants at 23.50 you breakeven if the common price is at $35 once you can exercise the warrants. Everything above that is gravy. With SHLL at 47.80, if you actually like the company and intend to hold it for a while, the warrants are the way to go.

That doesn't mean anything is guaranteed--the common can drop below that $35 figure--but your odds are better in the warrants than the common right now.

author: jfelski
body:
It did have a reverse split in 2005 and 2007 but both were only a 2-1 split. This does not appear to be what screwed you. The company filed bankruptcy and as part of the restructuring dropped their outstanding shares into warrants, at a conversion of 2.5%. The warrants are good for three years for the new ticker, DEN. Long story short, the company fucked you big time. Turned your shares into shit, restructured, launched new shares at around $17 a share and now have a shit ton of cash and you have a warrant for the new stock. Good luck. 

Plus side, the warrants are up 96% premarket today, told you to buy the dip....lol

author: sirvapedalot
body:
Good luck getting around their 45 patents including foundational ones like the patent of “High Definition Lidar Systems”. There is a reason they have already been able to enforce the patents against random Chinese companies.

Don't believe me? Lets look at what happened when Google Waymo, one of the largest companies in the world, tried to sue Uber for LIDAR patent infringement:

[https://www.engadget.com/2018-10-02-waymo-self-driving-lidar-patent-infringement-uber-velodyne.html](https://www.engadget.com/2018-10-02-waymo-self-driving-lidar-patent-infringement-uber-velodyne.html)

&#x200B;

>The US Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) **rejected 53 out of 56 claims in Waymo's 936 patent**...One of the reasons for the rejection is that some of the core design solutions were **previously patented by another lidar manufacturer, Velodyne**. Coincidentally, Velodyne used to sell its lidars to Waymo before the latter decided to build a product of its own from scratch.  
>  
>Theoretically, **Velodyne could now accuse Waymo of infringing its own 558 patent**, based on the USPTO's recent ruling.
